text: The Sarikoli language (also Selekur, Sarikul, Sariqul, Sarik√∂li) is an indigenous Pamiri language spoken by the Pamiri people in Xinjiang, China and northern Pakistan. It is an endangered language spoken by only 16,000 people. ==References== Category:Pamiri languages Category:Languages of China Category:Languages of Gilgit-Baltistan Category:Iranian languages
title: Sarikoli language
